programme.title: 鳳凰午間專列
programme.desc: 《鳳凰午間專列》: 鳳凰中午的強檔新聞節目, 採取泛中華的報道態度, 關注中國內地的新聞, 也關注香港、台灣以及國際的新聞, 視野更廣闊, 話語空間亦突顯其獨特之處。節目簡潔、實事求事、快人一步, 將新聞帶給正在享用午餐的您, 讓您在休息時段毋須讀報而能輕鬆地接收全球最新出爐的新聞資訊。

programme.desc: 《總編輯時間》: 鳳凰總編輯重點編選和剖析一天最值得注意的頭條新聞, 解構事情的來龍去脈, 讓觀眾以評論員的眼光看世界, 深度瞭解重點事項。

programme.title: 新聞今日談
programme.desc: 《新聞今日談》: 節目針對當天最熱門時事問題, 在觀眾最關注的時刻即時作出評論, 讓觀眾更洞悉事件的真相。

programme.title: 鳳凰焦點新聞 2300
programme.desc: 《鳳凰焦點新聞》: 聚焦重大時政議題, 重大社會事件和新聞熱點, 原創性挖掘更多時事與背景, 分析梳理新聞的前因後果, 人物命運, 呈現權威觀點。

programme.title: 總編輯時間

The Whole Story with Anderson Cooper: Change Amplified: Live Music and the Climate Crisis
programme.desc: Bill Weir speaks with the biggest stars working to revolutionize the environmental impact of live music; exploring their efforts to reform an industry known for its massive energy use and waste.

programme.title: All There Is With Anderson Cooper: Ken Burns' History With Grief
programme.desc: Documentary filmmaker Ken Burns has been called "America's biographer," but in this moving conversation, he reveals how his own history has been shaped by early loss - the death of his mother Lyla when Ken was eleven years old.

programme.title: CNN Heroes: An All-Star Tribute
programme.desc: Anderson Cooper and Laura Coates co-host the 19th annual celebration honoring the year's Top 5 CNN Heroes and reveal the viewer's choice for CNN Hero of the Year.

programme.title: The Whole Story with Anderson Cooper: The Simril(l)s: A Family in Black and White
programme.desc: Sara Sidner shares a powerful portrait of a multi-racial Southern family that confronts and explores its painful shared history and comes together in spite of it. United, they consider how they can serve as a blueprint for racial healing.

programme.title: Amanpour: Halla Tomasdottir & Pamela Hogan; Gayle Young; Cory Doctorow
programme.desc: Christiane speaks with Iceland's President Halla Tomasdottir and film director Pamela Hogan about the day 50 years ago when Iceland's women went on strike to demand equal treatment, and the recent documentary telling the full story. Also, CNN's former Cairo bureau chief Gayle Young speaks with Christiane about her career and recent memoir, "Update", and Hari Sreenivasan speaks with tech writer Cor

programme.title: All There Is With Anderson Cooper: Luke Bryan: Grief, Faith, and Music
programme.desc: Luke Bryan is one of country music's biggest stars. He's also faced great loss. In this personal and revealing conversation with Anderson, Luke shares how faith, family, and music have helped him "do what you do to get through.".

programme.title: Call to Earth: Call to Earth: Beyond the Lens
programme.desc: World-renowned wildlife photographer Chris Fallows leads an inspiring journey from South Africa to Tanzania, highlighting the threats facing some of Africa's most wild places and celebrating those racing to save them.

While in the U.S. capital, he caught up with the likes of USMNT Head Coach Mauricio Pochet

programme.title: Vital Signs with Dr. Sanjay Gupta: The Future of Human Hibernation
programme.desc: We all know about animals that hibernate., the ones who press slow down or pause on nearly all metabolic functions like heart rate, blood flow, brain waves and body temperature, only to wake up as if nothing happened. programme.title: Seasons: 'Slow Luxury' with Laura Jackson
programme.desc: In a world obsessed with speed, new CNN host Laura Jackson invites us to rediscover the beauty of taking our time. Known for her effortless hosting and passion for creating meaningful moments, Laura believes that true luxury is about stories, craft, and connection.

programme.title: All There Is With Anderson Cooper: Luke Bryan: Grief, Faith, and Music
programme.desc: Luke Bryan is one of country music's biggest stars. He's also faced great loss. In this personal and revealing conversation with Anderson, Luke shares how faith, family, and music have helped him "do what you do to get through.".

programme.title: The Whole Story with Anderson Cooper: Operation Panda
programme.desc: The Smithsonian National Zoo is set to reopen its panda exhibit. David Culver covers the arrival of the first giant pandas sent from China to the U.S. in 24 years and examines the history of panda diplomacy.

programme.title: The Whole Story with Anderson Cooper: Saving Venice
programme.desc: Erica Hill explores the future of Venice, a city threatened by rising sea levels and the more immediate threat of overwhelming tourism. She speaks with locals working to preserve the city's traditions and address climate change.

programme.title: All There Is With Anderson Cooper: Luke Bryan: Grief, Faith, and Music
programme.desc: Luke Bryan is one of country music's biggest stars. He's also faced great loss. In this personal and revealing conversation with Anderson, Luke shares how faith, family, and music have helped him "do what you do to get through.".

programme.title: Fareed Zakaria GPS: Fareed Zakaria GPS: Disconnected: Life in a Disruptive Digital Age
programme.desc: With 20% of Americans feeling lonely every day and the number of people without close friends having quadrupled over the past 35 years, Fareed Zakaria examines how the digital age is reshaping the very fabric of human connection.

programme.title: The Whole Story with Anderson Cooper: Adaptation Nation: A Climate Crisis Survival Guide
programme.desc: From the hurricane-afflicted Gulf Coast to the fire-ravaged mountains of California, communities are rebuilding in the face of disaster. CNN's Bill Weir explores the lessons learned and how we can adapt to a changing climate.

programme.title: Amanpour: Thant Myint; Werner Herzog; Arundhati Roy
programme.desc: Christiane speaks with historian Thant Myint-U about his book "Peacemaker", documenting the life of his grandfather U Thant, who as UN Secretary-General in the 1960s became a pivotal player in resolving wars around the world. programme.title: Blueprint: Blueprint: Mongolia
programme.desc: Many people travel to Mongolia to disconnect, to escape into the vast wilderness and switch off. But for Mongolians, connectivity is everything. The country has 3.5 million people and 5 million active phone numbers. Everywhere you look in the capital city Ulaanbaatar, people are glued to their phones. A vibrant startup scene in the city is driving innovation and diversifying Mongolia's economy bey

programme.title: POV: POV: Edo
programme.desc: POV?travels away from well-worn tourist trails to discover the country's essence through the lens of its people. Meet those who dedicate their lives to safeguarding the culture through art, food, and more, and how these facets co-exist within modern culture today.

programme.title: The Journey Matters: The Philippines
programme.desc: Travel and tourism to the Philippines surpassed pre-pandemic levels in 2024. Visitors now focus on authentic and sustainable experiences that preserve traditions, the environment and support local communities.
